txt.en:
'That was a decent show, I suppose.'

Tegwyn struggles to suppress any show of excitement.

'One more! Show me one more skill of yours, and make it incredible!'

<rgb=#00CCCC>HINT</rgb>: Press the 'J' key to open the traits panel. Choose a 'specialization' for your class to gain new skills and abilities. Don't worry, you can always change your mind later!

After you choose a specialization, use <rgb=#00ff00>Lesser Anthem I - Resonance</rgb> or <rgb=#00ff00>Lesser Anthem II - Dissonance</rgb> on the training dummy.
Used <rgb=#00ff00>Lesser Anthem I - Resonance</rgb> or <rgb=#00ff00>Lesser Anthem II - Dissonance</rgb> on the training dummy
Prologue, Chapter 2: Skills of an Adventurer
Use <rgb=#00ff00>Coda of Fury</rgb>, <rgb=#00ff00>Coda of Melody</rgb>, or <rgb=#00ff00>Coda of Resonance</rgb> on the training dummy

'Well? I'm ready for you to show off your combat skills... and if you impress me, I'll give up this Uruk sword. It had better be a good demonstration, or the bargain is done!'

You explain that Minstrels often rely on <rgb=#00ff00>Minor Ballads</rgb> to build themselves up and prepare to use more potent abilities. Tegwyn nods.

'Interesting. Well, let's see it! That's what this training dummy is for, after all!'
Used <rgb=#00ff00>Minor Ballad</rgb> on the training dummy ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Talk to Tegwyn by the training dummy

'That was pretty good, I suppose....\n\n'Fine! You've upheld your side of our bargain, [placeholder], and I will do the same. Here's Madthrug's weapon, as I promised. You'll bring it back to that Ranger for me, I expect? Mother and father will be pleased, but I still say I could have handled such a weapon!'
Tegwyn reluctantly hands you the Uruk's blade

'You recovered the Uruk blade from Tegwyn before he hurt himself with it? Very well done, [placeholder].'

Meneldir gets a faraway look in his eye, and gazes over the surrounding wall of Mossward.

'I remember being that age, and dreaming only of adventure, of excitement. I was not so very different from young Tegwyn when I was a boy growing up in the Angle of Mitheithel, where my people dwell. I do not judge him harshly for taking the sword, and I hope you will not either. His parents busy themselves with the work of fortifying Mossward's defences, and I daresay they remain unaware of the boy's mischief. I will not tell them if you do not, [placeholder].'
Use <rgb=#00ff00>Lesser Anthem I - Resonance</rgb> or <rgb=#00ff00>Lesser Anthem II - Dissonance</rgb> on the training dummy
Tegwyn agreed to relinquish the Uruk sword if you are able to impress him with a demonstration of your combat ability.

'Well? I'm ready for you to show off your combat skills... and if you impress me, I'll give up this Uruk sword. It had better be a good demonstration, or the bargain is done!'

You explain that Minstrels often rely on <rgb=#ffff00>Minor Ballads</rgb> to build themselves up and prepare to use more potent abilities. Tegwyn nods.

'Interesting. Well, let's see it! That's what this training dummy is for, after all!'
Tegwyn is waiting for you to demonstrate your combat ability by using <rgb=#00ff00>Minor Ballad</rgb> on the training dummy.
'You upheld your side of the bargain, [placeholder], and so have I. Now take that blade to the Ranger before I change my mind! I still say I could have handled it.'
You have fulfilled your end of the bargain. Will Tegwyn relinquish the Uruk's blade to you, as he agreed?
Use <rgb=#00ff00>Minor Ballad</rgb> on the training dummy ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'That was all right, I guess. But surely you have more powerful attacks at your disposal?'

You explain that once a Minstrel has built up three <rgb=#ffff00>Ballads</rgb>, they can use a powerful <rgb=#ffff00>Coda</rgb>.

'Wow, I want to see that!'
Meneldir is by the east gate of Mossward.\n\nNow that you have recovered the Uruk blade, you should bring it to Meneldir.
Talk to Tegwyn by the training dummy
You have demonstrated a Minor Ballad for Tegwyn. Will he relinquish the Uruk's blade to you, as he agreed?
Talk to Tegwyn by the training dummy
Bring the Uruk blade to Meneldir by the east gate of Mossward
Tegwyn is waiting for you to to use a Coda on the training dummy.
You have demonstrated a Coda for Tegwyn. Will he relinquish the Uruk's blade to you, as he agreed?
Tegwyn is waiting for you to to use <rgb=#00ff00>Lesser Anthem I - Resonance</rgb> or <rgb=#00ff00>Lesser Anthem II - Dissonance</rgb> on the training dummy.
Used <rgb=#00ff00>Coda of Fury</rgb>, <rgb=#00ff00>Coda of Melody</rgb>, or <rgb=#00ff00>Coda of Resonance</rgb> on the training dummy

'That was a decent show, I suppose.'

Tegwyn struggles to suppress any show of excitement.

'One more! Show me one more skill of yours, and make it incredible!'

<rgb=#00CCCC>HINT</rgb>: Press the 'J' key to open the traits panel. Choose a 'specialization' for your class to gain new skills and abilities. Don't worry, you can always change your mind later!

After you choose a specialization, use <rgb=#00ff00>Lesser Anthem I - Resonance</rgb> or <rgb=#00ff00>Lesser Anthem II - Dissonance</rgb> on the training dummy.

'That was all right, I guess. But surely you have more powerful attacks at your disposal?'

You explain that once a Minstrel has built up three <rgb=#ffff00>Ballads</rgb>, they can use a powerful <rgb=#ffff00>Coda</rgb>.

'Wow, I want to see that!'
